input.description: XML document conforming to the ConnectionDetails Concept that contains the information required to execute a command via command line
The path used to access the distributed file system.

If no parameters are entered, the output will display only the names of the root and its links. If a value of "partial" is entered then the output will display any comments associated with the root. If a value of "full" is entered the the output will display the names of the root and its links, any comments associated with the root, and any targets associated with the links.
Valid values: partial, full

output.description: XML document consisting of one or more <line> elements that contain the command response. Each <line> element contains an index attribute indicating the order in which the information was returned by the command.
Did the operation succeed? Valid values: true

xslt-stylesheet.stylesheet: <xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="yes" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <fat-command> <command os-id="Linux"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">echo Command not supported on Linux.</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="SunOS"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">echo Command not supported on SunOS.</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="Windows Default"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">dfscmd /view </xsl:text> <xsl:if test="string-length('${dfs root}') !=0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">\\$[dfs root] </xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${view type}') !=0 and '${view type}' ='partial'"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">/${view type}</xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${view type}') !=0 and '${view type}' ='full'"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">/${view type}</xsl:text> </xsl:if> </command> <command os-id="Windows XP"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">echo Command not supported on Windows XP.</xsl:text> </command> </fat-command> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

documentation.description: Get DFS Share Entries View share details for the specified DFS root.
